name: iron(III) chloride production, without water, in 12% iron solution state | iron(III) chloride, without water, in a 12% iron solution state | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12013/documentation

This dataset represents the production of iron(III) chloride in the region of Québec. The functional unit represent 1 kg of iron(III) chloride (FeCl3). The final product is however sold in a 12% iron solution state, which corresponds to 34.85% (FeCl3) or 58.08% solid iron(III) chloride (if the hydrated iron(III) chloride form is assumed to be FeCl3.6H2O).;The data providing manufacturing company makes two grades of product solution, 12% iron and 14% iron. The energy and material inputs per kg of iron(III) chloride differ between the two grades sufficiently to consider them as different products and justify the creation of two distinct datasets.

This activity starts with the raw material delivery at the manufacturing plant gate.

This activity ends with the Iron(III) chloride solution at the manufacturing plant gate.
The dataset includes the raw materials and energy consumption for production, estimation of the infrastructure (approximation).
The process starts by pumping iron(II) chloride (spent pickling acids from the iron and steel manufacturing industry) in a reactor to react with pure liquid chlorine (Fe2+ converted into Fe3+). The solution in then transfered to a digester to react with steel scrap to increase the Fe concentration (Fe3+ ions convert back into Fe2+). The solution if then filtered to remove  particles which would block the following heat exchanger, the resulting sludge is used internally as coagulant. After cooling, pure liquid chlorine is again added to convert Fe2+ back into Fe3+. After a final cooling stage, the iron(III) chloride solution is sent to storage tanks.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from a single manufacturing company in the region of Québec. They are used as average for the region of Québec.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data based on questionnaire from one manufacturing company, except for the infrastructure which is based on standard assumptions on plant lifetime and annual production volume.

exchanges.description: Measured value. Reported as spent pickling acid solution obtained from the steel industry. The amount of iron(II) chloride, or FeCl2, was adjusted for the average iron concentration of the spent pickling acid solution used (11 to 14% iron or 25 to 32% FeCl2) given by data reporting manufacturing company.

exchanges.description: Measured value. Represents the extra amount of water (0.00017323 kg) added to the reaction tank to compensate for the evaporation losses during the mixing and reaction, and the make-up water (0.17214434 kg) for the cooling system (exothermic reaction).

Measured and calculated value. Represents the electricity used for the production process itself (agitator and pumps) and the electricity used for the heating of the exterior piping system during winter, building air conditioning during summer (exothermic reaction) and lighting.
